PR approved by at least one committer and no changes requested.
PR approved by anyone and no changes requested.

try use  regexp_replace   select  regexp_replace('http://www.baidu.com:9090','http', 'ftp')  .
The replace function is not mentioned in the documentation.

This demo includes reading hdfs files and writing doris through streaming load、 reading kafka message queues and writing doris through streaming load  and reading doris tables through spark doris connector to build  DataFrame dataset.
> nice

@xinghuayu007 , good job ! currently doris-vectorized is working on project [doris-vectorized](https://github.com/doris-vectorized/doris-vectorized)
some issues write todo list. you can join us if you are willing to.

how about comibine two configs into one config, use reserved_history_list instead of reserved_history_starts and reserved_history_ends, and we can set the property like "[2021-01-01, 2021-01-31] , [2021-02-03, 2021-02-15]", and use pattern to check the property and extract property

I am also concerned about this issue.

> try use regexp_replace select regexp_replace('http://www.baidu.com:9090','http', 'ftp') .

They are different functions.

> The replace function is not mentioned in the documentation.

The docmentation of `replace` function already exists. But it is not showing in the side bar of doc website. 
I'll fix it. 

Besides, you also can see the help contents by command `help replcace`.

PR approved by at least one committer and no changes requested.
PR approved by anyone and no changes requested.

Actually, this is a feature, and this feature will change usage interface. When this is merged, it is hard to changed any more, because a database should keep back compatible with old version.
I suggest that it will be better to add user interface to let people discuss.

I see a good case from Impala community, which I think we can refer. 
The following mail list is about adding unnest feature.
https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r1095fd324e65b8fbbc31b7da61a69367e08bbf5cb6fcd1fd9e72f133%40%3Cdev.impala.apache.org%3E
can you show your flinksql ?

> how about comibine two configs into one config, use reserved_history_list instead of reserved_history_starts and reserved_history_ends, and we can set the property like "[2021-01-01, 2021-01-31] , [2021-02-03, 2021-02-15]", and use pattern to check the property and extract property

Great idea. And i've finished changing it to `reserved_history_periods`. And ut will be modified later.
PR approved by at least one committer and no changes requested.
PR approved by anyone and no changes requested.
@JNSimba  Has this problem been solved?

> @JNSimba Has this problem been solved?

Specify the newline character to set the 
     sink.properties.line_delimiter   parameters

@JNSimba thanks for your reply. here is my code, and some errors.
doris ddl：
```sql
CREATE TABLE `product` (
  `id` int(11) NULL COMMENT "",
...
  `gmt_modified` datetime NULL COMMENT "",
  `gmt_create` datetime NULL COMMENT ""
) ENGINE=OLAP
DUPLICATE KEY(`id`, `id_hash`)
COMMENT "OLAP"
DISTRIBUTED BY HASH(`id`) BUCKETS 10
PROPERTIES (
"replication_num" = "3",
"in_memory" = "false",
"storage_format" = "V2"
);

```


flink sql doris-sink ddl：

```sql
CREATE TABLE product (
 id INT,
...
 gmt_modified TIMESTAMP(6),
 gmt_create TIMESTAMP(6) ) 
WITH (  
 'connector' = 'doris', 
 'fenodes' = 'n3:8031', 
  'table.identifier' = 'dev.product',  
  'username' = 'root',
  'sink.batch.size' = '100',
  'sink.properties.column_separator' = '\x01',
  'sink.properties.line_delimiter' = '\x02',
  'sink.batch.interval' = '2s' , 
  'password' = 'doris'
);
```
```sql
# flink insert sql
insert into product 
select * from product_cdc_table ;
```

When we write data to dorsi by flink streaming, have following error occurs.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33626973/133186128-5f0e2aeb-7660-4df2-8f52-7844b6ffd05d.png)
doris sink format， not use GenericRowData. use RowData::FieldGetter， fixed it。
PR approved by at least one committer and no changes requested.
PR approved by anyone and no changes requested.

> Actually, this is a feature

Thanks for pointing out.

>  this feature will change usage interface. 

What do you mean?  I'm a little confused. 

With this feature, users can not only import Hive data to Doris olap table by Spark load, but also can query hive external table by Doris. These two funcitons dose not confict. It keeps back compatible with old versions.
please rebase master to solve the conflicts problem

> > Actually, this is a feature
> 
> Thanks for pointing out.
> 
> > this feature will change usage interface.
> 
> What do you mean? I'm a little confused.
> 
> With this feature, users can not only import Hive data to Doris olap table by Spark load, but also can query hive external table by Doris. These two funcitons dose not confict. It keeps back compatible with old versions.

I think you misunderstand my point, what I want to say is that this issue will introduce new SQL interface, such as 'CREATE TABLE'. This needs to be disscussed before coding to avoid later modification.

Doris do not support setting these property for each partition in `create table stmt`.
So what will you do to support this?
Could you give a certain example?

> this issue will introduce new SQL interface , such as 'CREATE TABLE'. 

This issue does not introduce any new SQL interface. 

We already have create hive external table syntax, which can see by command `help create table`.
What I intend to do is to implement the query hive external table. Dose not change any SQL interface.

You can see the create hive table syntax in the related PR, which is exactly the same as Doris' existing create hive external table statement.

> @JNSimba thanks for your reply. here is my code, and some errors.
> doris ddl：
> 
> ```sql
> CREATE TABLE `product` (
>   `id` int(11) NULL COMMENT "",
> ...
>   `gmt_modified` datetime NULL COMMENT "",
>   `gmt_create` datetime NULL COMMENT ""
> ) ENGINE=OLAP
> DUPLICATE KEY(`id`, `id_hash`)
> COMMENT "OLAP"
> DISTRIBUTED BY HASH(`id`) BUCKETS 10
> PROPERTIES (
> "replication_num" = "3",
> "in_memory" = "false",
> "storage_format" = "V2"
> );
> ```
> 
> flink sql doris-sink ddl：
> 
> ```sql
> CREATE TABLE product (
>  id INT,
> ...
>  gmt_modified TIMESTAMP(6),
>  gmt_create TIMESTAMP(6) ) 
> WITH (  
>  'connector' = 'doris', 
>  'fenodes' = 'n3:8031', 
>   'table.identifier' = 'dev.product',  
>   'username' = 'root',
>   'sink.batch.size' = '100',
>   'sink.properties.column_separator' = '\x01',
>   'sink.properties.line_delimiter' = '\x02',
>   'sink.batch.interval' = '2s' , 
>   'password' = 'doris'
> );
> ```
> 
> ```sql
> # flink insert sql
> insert into product 
> select * from product_cdc_table ;
> ```
> 
> When we write data to dorsi by flink streaming, have following error occurs.
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33626973/133186128-5f0e2aeb-7660-4df2-8f52-7844b6ffd05d.png)

doris version: 0.14
flink-doris-connector version : master
flink version ： 1.12.2

When we repalce `column_separator=%x01 ` and `line_delimiter=%x02`, have other error occurs :
```bash
Reason: actual column number is more than schema column number. actual number: 1900 sep: %, schema number: 19; . src line: [689%x018a7c7089faaf00c850b90154e74fb821%x01101787%x0111%x010%x010%x010%x01%x01%x01QARFEE 
```
We check barch-0.14 and master, look the commit message `[Load] Support multi bytes LineDelimiter and ColumnSeparator` (#5462) in  `broker_scanner.cpp`, so we are going to verify it.

when use show create test 
```CREATE TABLE `test` (
  `courseId` int(11) NOT NULL COMMENT "",
  `lessonId` int(11) NOT NULL COMMENT "",
  `type` int(11) REPLACE_IF_NOT_NULL NULL COMMENT ""
) ENGINE=OLAP
AGGREGATE KEY(`courseId`, `lessonId`)
COMMENT "测试"
DISTRIBUTED BY HASH(`courseId`) BUCKETS 150
PROPERTIES (
"replication_num" = "3",
"in_memory" = "false",
"storage_format" = "V2",
"storage_medium" = "SSD",
"cooldownTime" = "9999-12-31 23:59:59"
);```

add storage_medium and cooldownTime

```
CREATE TABLE `test` (
  `courseId` int(11) NOT NULL COMMENT "",
  `lessonId` int(11) NOT NULL COMMENT "",
  `type` int(11) REPLACE_IF_NOT_NULL NULL COMMENT ""
) ENGINE=OLAP
AGGREGATE KEY(`courseId`, `lessonId`)
COMMENT "测试"
DISTRIBUTED BY HASH(`courseId`) BUCKETS 150
PROPERTIES (
"replication_num" = "3",
"in_memory" = "false",
"storage_format" = "V2"
);
```

select * from test limit 10
select * from test limit 1, 10 (default order by courseId)

> please rebase master to solve the conflicts problem

Done.
Currently, there is a problem. If there is no show create table, it may cause HDD to be built in the next table reconstruction
Could you please provide core stack and issue ?
PR approved by at least one committer and no changes requested.
PR approved by anyone and no changes requested.

here, we only need to check state of meta object when get write lock except the following conditions,
1. replay operation
2. already get parent meta object lock
This is not a bug report, but I cannot find a suitable issue template to use.
@yangzhg Hi, can you help me look the problem. i think this is similar #6550

> You should re-format files, and use whitespace instead of tab.
> you can try `clang-format -i -style=file /path/to/file` in youre code root

ok

> ```
> CREATE TABLE `test` (
>   `courseId` int(11) NOT NULL COMMENT "",

> PROPERTIES (
> "replication_num" = "3",
> "in_memory" = "false",
> "storage_format" = "V2"
> );
> ```
> 
> select * from test limit 10
> select * from test limit 1, 10 (default order by courseId)

It makes me confused...
And what about a more complex query?

PR approved by anyone and no changes requested.

> > @mincwang it is work to change to other characters，hexadecimal may be has problem
> 
> What do you recommend set for `column_separator` and `line_delimiter` ?

It can be set as a character that does not appear frequently according to the specific business, or it can be set as a combination of multiple characters

> > 
> > 
> > What do you recommend set for `column_separator` and `line_delimiter` ?

But we doris version is 0.14，only master version support of  multiple characters ，fix above problem by this PR #5462.

> > >

Sorry, I may not make it clear, I mean it can be specified as multiple letters, like **column_separator=doris**
yes， if you disableOperatorChaining， RowDataSerializer will Serialize RowData to BinaryRowData
